mdRecord.dcterms:title: Mortimer Fleishhacker House, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Greene and Greene (American architectural firm, founded 1894) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: General view of side with terrace

Built as a private family residence in 1911, architect Charles Greene continued to work on the formal gardens, added a swimming pool in 1916, and a magnificent water garden in 1927. -- http://www.almanacnews.com/morgue/1999/1999_01_06.fleischh.html [work]

The main residence, designed primarily for summer use, was constructed around a dog-leg plan under a hipped roof, the main axis parallel to the front elevation and the rear terrace. -- http://www.usc.edu/dept/architecture/greeneandgreene/150.html [work]
